summary: "Things Fall Apart" is a famous novel by Nigerian author Chinua Achebe, published in 1958. It tells the story of Okonkwo, a powerful leader in the Igbo community in Nigeria, before the arrival of European colonists. The book describes Igbo culture and how it changed when missionaries and colonial forces came. It's an important African novel, widely read in schools across the continent and around the world. The story is split into three parts, showing Okonkwo's life, his struggles, and how his community changed with colonialism.
title: Things Fall Apart
